Posts.Content: On 2/7/2008 Katduu wrote: I had breast caner 12 years ago.  It has came back in my liver, abdomin, and bones.  I am using the drug xeloda.  I have been on this drug for about 10 months and my cancer count is dropping.  My problem is that the doctor says I will need to stay on this drug even when my cancer count is normal.  I would like to know if any one else is on this drug and if they have long term side effects.   Thanks.   Hello, I had breast cancer 12 years ago and it reoccured in 2006.  April I began chemo drugs and have been going through other chemotheraphy when the current one fails.  I started yesterday a new chemo infusion, but before that I was on Xeloda - only for 2 months.  My side effects were so bad (on the bottom of my feet and my hands), not to mention other effects which I had not experienced with other chemotheraphy, coupled with a CT scan that showed no improvement, the doctor took me off immediately.  It has been 2 weeks now and it doesn't look like I am getting back to normal on my hands and feet very quickly.  I know this didn't answer your question, but I am amazed to see how long you have been on Xeloda--I don't know how you do it, but good luck--it looks like you're getting some real positive results with this med. Judith Judith
